Joint Venture.definition: a cooperative business agreement or partnership between two or more parties that is usually limited to a single enterprise and that involves the sharing of resources

1.definition: a cooperative business agreement or partnership between two or more parties that is usually limited to a single enterprise and that involves the sharing of resources, control, profits, and losses compare

2.definition: a criminal undertaking by two or more persons in which each intentionally takes part used in the law of Massachusetts
